summary: rheumatoid arthritis (RA), a chronic symmetrical autoimmune disease, is characterized by synovial inflammation and proliferation accompanied by cartilage erosion and bone loss. more than one-third of patients eventually experience employment disability and lower quality of life because of this disease. mortality rates in RA patients are higher than in the healthy population. studies have shown that the levels of DKK1 in serum were significantly higher in RA patients. treatment with an anti-DKK1 antibody has attenuated bone erosion. over the last 20 years, great progress has been made in developing DNA vaccines. four B cell epitopes and designed a novel DKK1 multiepitope DNA vaccine. our data demonstrated that this DNA vaccine ameliorated bone erosion significantly in mice
